website_summaries.verdict: If you're budget-conscious, the D7 could be the modem/router you're looking for. Then again, if you're budget conscious, why are you looking at 802.11ac routers?
pros: Despite the drop in price, the Archer D7 still performs at the 5GHz end of town, and has nearly all the features of the D9
cons: Options and web UI design aren't as advanced as competitors, and 2.4GHz performance isn't great

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Fast
customer_reviews.text: The setup CD did not work, and the documented manual setup did not work --- but by typing 192.168.1.1 into the Internet browser, I gained access to the unit. After that, I was able to get it working quickly; however, I'm very experienced. The range is very strong (tested with a special device). Users who have limited experience may have setup problems. I had to contact TP-Link's customer service once a few years ago, and I had a good experience. This is my second TP-Link modem-router because the first one malfunctioned after an electrical storm. SO, put it on a good surge protector..
customer_reviews.author: Bones

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link Wireless Dual Band Modem/Router
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from Amazon Warehouse Deals. Reviewers highly recommended the TP-Link Wireless Dual Band Router/Modem as did a technical specialist at CenturyLink. Setup was very easy and connected to my new, lighting fast CenturyLink internet in about 5 minutes including unpackaging. The DirectTV technician connected the new Genie HD DVR to the TP-Link in seconds allowing for internet access on our TV. Our TV is a Samsung Smart TV but the DirectTV - TP-Link interface is MUCH easier to use. All of the install directions and owners manual are contained on a mini-CD which is very convenient. The owners manual is very well written and comprehensive. The capabilities of the TP-Link are state-of-the-art. Very highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: More than ADSL, also for cable modem
customer_reviews.text: This one is the best find! I originally ordered the AC1750, but cancelled that when I found this one. Besides bigger bandwidth, this wireless router also come with "modem" capability which help me reduced my two boxes (my old modem and WIFI router are separate boxes) down to one. Moreover, this modem does not only support ADSL2+ (I originally thought that is what it was for, as I have ADSL). It can also be used for cable modem. This makes the Archer D9 future proof should I ever move or change my Telco/Internet provider.
customer_reviews.author: Serryth

customer_reviews.title: Update the firmware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router/modem back in Jan. and although it was better than what i had i was never completely satisfied so didn't write a review. Now, few months later after updating the firmware this thing is working better than i ever expected......it was even easy to update the firmware.....easier than anticipated anyway.......this router/modem is the best of the 3 that i have had.....my amazon firestick even works better now that i have updated it. If you are having a problem with the wireless using this router i would definitely recommend updating the firmware..it has made a world of difference in this modems stability and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caveat Emptor
customer_reviews.text: it was incredibly easy to set up, and it didn't erase the settings on my intermittently failing (and annoying to set up) five year old Actiontec, which is good, because the Actiontec performed like a racehorse compared to the 2.4 or 5GHz settings of the Archer 750. It was great within spitting distance in the same room, but a few yards of air and a wood wall and pffft. To be fair, it was an Amazon Warehouse "packing will be damaged" so maybe someone returned it for the same reason I did, in which case I am slamming an Archer product for Amazon's return policy - but it is supposed to be in working order, correct? Caveat Emptor
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works For a Few Weeks But Then Drops 5Ghz channel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to increase the speed of my wifi and network. It worked great for two weeks but then the 5G channel started dropping off. This happened several times over the span of a week. I contacted Amazon technical support which was very good to deal with but after following their advice and reading the other reviews in more detail, I returned the item. Thank goodness for Amazon's good return policy. I replaced it with a NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 and just set it up. Fingers crossed that it will work fine for us. Either way I will provide a review of the device.
customer_reviews.author: M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best router I've ever had, did everything I wanted and much more. Favorite thing about it was that it let me put spaces between words on my network names, it annoys me to no end when routers restrict your network names to about 8 characters and no spaces, nothing doing with this one. Really though, no parameter was locked, no reasonable option unchangeable, it even let me throttle the network usage of each device connected individually and give network priority to any devices which pretty much eleminated any lag I had playing games online while others were on my wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Everything I could want in a DSL modem/router
customer_reviews.text: This is the heart of my wifi network. It automatically adjusted settings to be compatible with and connect to my Verizon DSL. I use it with a wireless Brother printer, a hardwired desktop, and two iPads, an iPod, and an iPhone. Added on a TP-Link TL-4220kit to one of the ethernet ports for optimuum home wi-fi coverage and use the 4220 for a wired ethernet connection to a Sony HDTV, resulting in smooth Netflix streaming. Adequately juggles the traffic with DSL bandwidth (3 mBits/sec) being the limiting factor.
customer_reviews.author: fourcatz

customer_reviews.title: Nice DSL router - supports many protocols
customer_reviews.text: First, I'm a big fan of TP-LINK products in general. Good value for the money. However, when it comes to this particular device, it's a little over priced for what it is. I was in a bad place and needed support for RFC1483 (bridged) to be compatible with the ISP DSLAM. This was one of the only devices that supported this protocol. There was a less expensive model available - but it wasn't shipping yet. It sis the job and sync'd with my provider - but at a price.....after all, it's just a DSL router. The device itself is sexy and the UI is better than in previous TP-Link routers...
customer_reviews.author: Len M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a TP-LINK product before, but for the price, I thought I'd give it a try. One problem I have found is that it is not very user friendly. I have CenturyLink, and it took me much longer than I expected to set up my connection, but a few resets later, it was connected. After everything is set up, it works great. The WiFi range is much better than my older netgear and much much faster. All in all, it is a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: ryan silcock

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but messes up my TV
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a Wi-Fi router and has Good range. but it wiped channel 55 and 43 off my TV. I thought it was a local problem everyone had until I saw someone else was getting 55 & 43 just fine. I then I unplug the router & found I had a crystal clear picture. Plug it back in even with the Wi-Fi off, It totally kills 55 and messes up 43. I called tech support, & got someone from japan or someplace that couldn't grasp the TV reception. She kept saying "OK your tv cant connect to the internet" I kept correcting her and she ends up repeating the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Modem is great. Verizon DSL... Not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Using with Verizon DSL. The Verizon modem had to be rebooted multiple times per day and streaming was impossible in the evenings. My internet speed still stinks but the connection stays up and streaming in the evenings usually works. If only I could replace Verizon like I replaced their modem. Wireless works well and covers my whole house (basement, 2 floors, and an attic bedroom) and no problems with many mobile devices on it. For users with multiple XBox Ones behind the modem, I am able to get open NAT on two using this modem. Verizon's modem only allowed strict NAT.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: when it was working it was fine, but it i was in use since April ...
customer_reviews.text: when it was working it was fine, but it i was in use since April of 2016 and started acting up on October 14 2017 i would think it should have lasted longer than about a year and a half, replaced with a centurylink dslmodem router and my problems cured so i know it was the router for sure. don't know if i would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely and upgrade for our family....
customer_reviews.text: We were still hooked up through our old Actiontec, which years ago was top of the line. This router/modem blows it out of the water. Can't say how it compares to top models, but for us this is perfect. We have Centurylink DSL and the set up was simple and took less than 5 minutes. We are a household of 7 and this can handle all the traffic of the family from gaming to streaming movies. I am very pleased with this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and great throughput for my DSL
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a modem & router so for me setup was even more simple. After reading some reviews I was apprehensive, but couldn't have been easier and much more simpler than setting up its predecessors. Haven't had to reboot but one time after a thunderstorm. Quick throughput and connection. Highly recommend even to a novice. I did connect my computer, via Ethernet cord, to setup just to avoid any issues.
customer_reviews.author: dk'Ole

customer_reviews.title: Archer modem/router
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding modem/router. It increased my LAN speeds and wireless speeds to levels I thought not possible. Also, drop outs I was experiencing hive virtually disappeared. I would recommend it to anybody for ADSL service which I have. Installation was effortless as well,
customer_reviews.author: Nemesis77

customer_reviews.title: Great range, setup took a little while to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Great range, setup took a little while to get used to, but well worth it. During a brief call to our isp to confirm some settings, the technician asked if we were setting up a TP-LINK (he said he could tell by the questions I was asking him). When I told him I was, he said he had never owned one, but remarked they sure were nice products.
customer_reviews.author: Staca B. Sadie

customer_reviews.title: The ADSL side has to deal with pretty crummy wiring in our new house but seems to ...
customer_reviews.text: Once past the AT&T installation process, this modem/router seems to work well. The ADSL side has to deal with pretty crummy wiring in our new house but seems to deliver 5 MBPS on that side, according to the test, and the wireless side covers the house. It has the standard browser interface. Not sure how any of it could be better except for the AT&T installation procedure which is painful
customer_reviews.author: Richard Booth

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I dislike about it
customer_reviews.text: The Tp-Link replaced my Embarq router. This one gave me wireless and hard wire capability. The only thing I dislike about it. I do have to do a hard reboot a lot more often then I ever had to do with my Embarq router. (shrug) The wireless portion works great. Over all pretty satisfied. Just make sure you know which router you are buying before purchasing. I almost got the just plain wireless one. Before disconnecting your old router ensure you know all the gateway info. It will make your setup go much easier. I had to re hook up my old router to find all the info I needed.. Good Luck
customer_reviews.author: Scott D. Atwater

customer_reviews.title: Good product and coverage
customer_reviews.text: Good product, good coverage after playing with antenna position for a little bit (I will recommend doing it along a Wifi survey tool like HeatMapper: [...]) my only problem has been once the Wireless access was disable, no explanation why, but I re enabled it and has been working fine since then.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Frias

customer_reviews.title: Good Product with possible connection problems.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with ADSL2 CenturyLink in the midwest. When it works, it performs very well. I am currently having problems keeping a constant connection but neither I nor the CL help desk has yet been able to determine whether the problem is the Archer D2 or the equipment on their end. My bet is faulty infrastructure but time will tell. I will update later if/when problem resolves.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up and works great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and works great. Have only reset two times since owning 3 months . We live in very rural area and dsl is a mess from provider .This helped so much and takes up less room. No pc only laptop and phones ,it was set up using laptop.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with U-Verse
customer_reviews.text: We spent several hours trying to get this set up, and even though it appeard to be connected, we kept getting a message saying 'no connection found'. Finally we saw in FINE PRINT that this product does not work with U-verse. Would it be unreassonable to expect this fact to be listed along with the product description?
customer_reviews.author: JackY

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a great device. I have everything I must need in one device. I can connect external hard drive to it and they works a good speed. Also, I can have ADSL and broadband connection. Just wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't.
customer_reviews.text: Once it failed, TP-link would only replace with a router (had to purchase a separate modem). End of life product no longer properly supported by manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: T. Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high speed modem.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item! Got it to replace another aging wireless-N TP-Link modem and has significantly increase the LAN speed for my home network. The dual 2.4 and 5 GHz band is a big boost and allowed me to control my devices wifi connection better. Now, time to upgrade my network adapters to match this modem speed.
customer_reviews.author: Dinn

customer_reviews.title: looks great and feels like it is constructed with quality
customer_reviews.text: works as described... looks great and feels like it is constructed with quality... This is my first TP-Link purchase and have used others (Linksys, etc...) and I like the simplicity of the user-friendliness of the interface.
customer_reviews.author: Fr@nk Gu@rin

customer_reviews.title: Great for ADSL.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. A lot of companies are switching to vdsl though so be careful because this doesn't support it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Smude

customer_reviews.title: What a different finally getting a good wireless modem can make
customer_reviews.text: What a different finally getting a good wireless modem can make. I dedicated the 5 ghz to streaming and didn't broadcast it. The internet speed was the same from the existing Actiontec Centurylink modem, but the wireless was faster, and less problematic.
customer_reviews.author: baboomski

customer_reviews.title: Frontier DSL
customer_reviews.text: Wow, the speed on the wireless is amazing. Using ir on my Frontier Dsl. During setup don't expect frontier to help. Good thing it was real easy when I figured out that my dsl was originally verizon. During setup it askes for your provider and frontier wasn't on the drop down lust but verizon was.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hyndman Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I have another TP-LINK router that has never given me ...
customer_reviews.text: I have another TP-LINK router that has never given me a problem. This particular one has reset itself twice now, for no apparent reason. It's not a big deal to setup, but having done it three times now I'm losing faith in this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Product is very easy to set up. Great range. Product on/off switch is a great bonus. Wifi On/Off button also an added bonus. The ability to add the guest wifi ensures you separate capabilities and not compromise your personal information shared within your home network.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie A. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: its good, most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: If your standing next to it or have a hard line in it, it works great. Also every other week or so, it acts like it's working, all the lights are on... But nobody home... the unit must be reset and even then you shouldn't walk away before you test the speed again because it may not reset the first time. It seems to be a finicky . It's not a turn on, leave it on and forget it machine. It needs attention. If your streaming more than one device, and surfing the Internet, it will start to buffer. Some times it buffers with only one streaming unit... (I have 5Mbps service)
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Less Wires, More Range!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased this item and was not overly impressed...but then I added an 802.11ac device (was all g and n before that) and tried it again. It works great - range is better than our previous setup and the ac speed is a real plus. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: A.I.

customer_reviews.title: Solid DSL modem router.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best DSL modem routers out there. I've tried about everything out there including the Netgear Nighthawk D7000, which is a great alternative also. I personally prefer the Archer D9 because of the online interface and the options they offer for port forwarding, which I personally use a lot. I recommend the TP-Link Archer D9 to anybody looking for a solid DSL modem router.
customer_reviews.author: carlos feliciano

customer_reviews.title: DSL router and modem
customer_reviews.text: This router has been working pretty well. The setup was a breeze. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Works with AT&T DSL with their assistance
customer_reviews.text: After some struggle, succeeded in connection to my AT&T DSL network. AT&T requires a unique password to connect which ended up being the cause of my problem. Strongly suggest contacting AT&T for special instructions. So far so good with connection.
customer_reviews.author: mib

customer_reviews.title: I watch my favorite movies on Netflix and Amazon without interruption
customer_reviews.text: No more buffing , I watch my favorite movies on Netflix and Amazon without interruption, also use my tablet and phone all at the same time
customer_reviews.author: Just do it!

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this after a good 5 hours on the phone with the teck we find out that the router/modem is not working. also followed the directions of another review about the settings for centurylink. So I boxed it all back up and will be sending it back tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: CJW

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install. Was the European version so set ...
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to install. Was the European version so set up had no usa option / providers had to do it manually and ring up my isp for codes. However once done worked well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cranky and Crusty, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to set up. seems to work well. It's dual band, and works better than my previous routers. One very big PLUS: if there is a power outage or fluctuation, you are back online MUCH FASTER than with other routers.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Lititz

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.. Replaced my netger n750 wndr4300 with archer ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good.. Replaced my netger n750 wndr4300 with archer d9 and man this d9 is 3x better range.. At 40feet I would only get 23DL/11up and now I get 77DL/11up.. Worth the $$$... difference between c9 and d9 is that the d9 can be used as a modem for dsl
customer_reviews.author: joel teczon

customer_reviews.title: This is my third one and the only reason for replacing them is because I like the features of a newer one
customer_reviews.text: Have had exceptional luck with TP-LINK ADSL2+, this is my third one and the only reason for replacing them is because I like the features of a newer one. The old ones always get put back in service elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rob K

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box - installation instructions were clear and it worked the first time. I was told that with DSL it would be too slow to watch Netflix. With this Modem/router I have been watching movies with no problems. My only regret is that I bought a 7ft high-speed cable - didn't need it as a descent length cable came with the package.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett Van Houten

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment, reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: Quick set up, strong signal. Printer set up was a bit more difficult but overall the performance and price is reasonable. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: Good and can handle high speeds as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good and can handle high speeds as advertised, but really cuts out once more than 4 devices are connected to it. Considering I a phone, computer, laptop, and Wii U, sometimes it will lose connection for a couple seconds to one of them if they're all on at once. Good for individuals, but not recommended for families.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after one month. Modem stopped connecting to ISP, and wireless stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: dgal1234

customer_reviews.title: Good improvement!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing-I have slow Centurylink internet here in Arkansas and this did help make it faster-even my wifi. I have several devices that use my wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki4kooky

customer_reviews.title: Probably fine but returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Probably a fine unit for what it is but returned it for a faster (more expensive) model with more features.
customer_reviews.author: stevefoobar

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Flexible Admin Controls
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit Touchy setting up - Replaced Our ISP's DSL Modem Nicely - Wifi N not as Fast as before but I got rid of the separate modem/Router Clutter
customer_reviews.author: D. Seeman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product in the games I recommend
customer_reviews.author: SILVER

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up and super coverage..
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set-up and super coverage! It equals or betters some big names in the business....
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Windows 7 connection issues
customer_reviews.text: We have had nothing but issues with this router since day one. Surface 3 PRO connects without any issues and 2 laptops running Windows 7 Professional cannot stay connected, no solutions. IPhone 5s connects but the speed is horrible! Too late to return, so stuck with it now and hoping new purchase of Netgear Modem/Router is better. Only 30 days to return, so will be more aware of time next time.
customer_reviews.author: CCAL

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the quality of the TP link AC750 modem ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received item quickly through Amazon. After hooking up modem and following set-up instructions in detail, the ADSL light would flash and never sync up. Numerous calls to internet provider and Archer technical help line determined that there was a problem with the modem itself. Not happy with the quality of the TP link AC750 modem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: I've had this since Aug 2016 and it just stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this since Aug 2016 and it just stopped working. I called for Tech Support and found that I was talking to someone who spoke very little english. A bit frustrating..we'll see if I get the RMA email.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Archer D7 AC1750 is junk!
customer_reviews.text: Wifi stopped after 8 hours. Returned it for something else.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: DOA.  Why can't we get tech support that is proficient in English?
customer_reviews.text: Was DOA. Spent 45 minutes with a Tech support person I could barely understand to have them confirm what I was telling them. Will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery T. Bagley

customer_reviews.title: I won't waste anymore of my life going through that again
customer_reviews.text: The product has an issue. Twice, I have had the same issue with this router and the warranty process is just awful! I won't waste anymore of my life going through that again. Very disappointed in the product and warranty process.
customer_reviews.author: Rmschoen

customer_reviews.title: Very good modem router
customer_reviews.text: Very good modem router, easy to configure, has an excelent performance and very good coverage. At the moment I'm very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Fernando Albertazzi

customer_reviews.title: It wouldn't work with SSID broadcasting disabled, unlike every ...
customer_reviews.text: It wouldn't work with SSID broadcasting disabled, unlike every other router I've had. So unless this was a defective unit you can choose between security or connectivity. TP-Link tech. support barely spoke English and didn't get back to me as promised once they escalated the issue.
customer_reviews.author: i

customer_reviews.title: Good product, be cautious of setup
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Setup is kind of tricky when splitting between bands. Do not expect assistance from your ISP in this process...
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Model does not work for Centurylink DSL
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Archer D7 AC1750 for Centurylink DSL service. After 3 hours of trouble shooting and speaking with Centurylink and TP-Link support, the TP-Link rep told me to just return it as it was defective. Won't buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: M. P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Google uses TP-LINK as an OEM. TP-LINK reviews in general are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: ST Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best DSL router that I've come across for my ISP ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best DSL router that I've come across for my ISP (Windstream). Helped a large part of my connection woes.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Suttle

customer_reviews.title: Good Modem
customer_reviews.text: This unit is much better than the last I used ... seems to work well except signal range is limited.
customer_reviews.author: chesskix

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy setup. One issue is not able to have the 2.4mhz network work at the ac speed. Ac only works with the 5mhz network so unless pc WiFi receiver supports dual band the 1300 mbps will not work. Radio transmission is much atronger than the oldèr a b g n routers.
customer_reviews.author: RNG

customer_reviews.title: Some Problems
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been able to keep my phone connected to it and a work laptop also couldn't connect. So far, with help haven't solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Keeps up with needs
customer_reviews.text: Keeps up with a family of 4 all watching netflix at one time
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: this wireless did not work well after days I have to reset to start again the operation
customer_reviews.author: isabel penzini

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: The router is very good and fast, but I'm finding the range is not as great as my previous router that croaked.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Worked for 3 days. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Works great - I am very happy with this! Fast, easy to set up, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Cup of Tea

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. WiFi would not cross the room. Returned it. Amazon return policy gets 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne J.

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy and it has pretty good whole house coverage
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy and it has pretty good whole house coverage. Bought it two weeks ago and it hasn't missed a beat.
customer_reviews.author: Dariel

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup with verizon took all of five minutes. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: It was not made clear that this was a 'refurbished' ...
customer_reviews.text: It was not made clear that this was a 'refurbished' item, nevertheless, the item did not power on, therefore unusable. Defective items should not be resold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works really well. It replaced an older unit ...
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. It replaced an older unit and range extender I had. Now I don't need an extender at all. You can point the antenna in different directions, which helps with reception.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DePue

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem/Router
customer_reviews.text: I had a flaky internet connection with a Westell 7500 modem/router so, when I bought my new Lenovo all-in-one, I had it built with a chip for the new AC 802.11 wireless standard. Of course, you then need an AC modem/router so I bought this one. It was a bear to set up mostly because you must have very specific codes from your ISP, but our internet connection is now as stable as a rock. It looks pretty cool, too.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Poor wifi range, even the cheaper 8968 is better... why TP-LINK? this ain't flagship adsl modem-router... U$S 200???
customer_reviews.author: Photobias

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: it is the best, but it does not compatible with DSL from Century Link.
customer_reviews.author: amadeus

customer_reviews.title: Amazing

customer_reviews.text: Frustated my expectations about the reach of the signal. Maybe I'm a dumb who doesn't know how to operate it correctly, but it is not as good as I thought. My house is 160 square meters and some spots are still blind.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic router / modem, especially for the price. Set it up to use with my AT&T DSL service.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A Frykman

customer_reviews.title: Too much trouble to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to set up. Couldn't get the set up disc to follow through to the end and when I called for support it was going to be a 45 minute wait. Uh yeah that makes sense. I just gave up and got a new Net Gear...just plugged it up and everything lit up with very little work on my part.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mock

customer_reviews.title: Totally Failed with MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: This router did not work with my macbook pro. My previous router worked fine. With this one, I had to re-enter wifi login info over and over. After a month, even that didn't work. And I lost the ability to connect to my printer. After hours researching how to solve the problem, including with both printer and router tech support, I gave up. I put back the old router, and everything worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product because it would not work no my Verizon net DSL.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Tp link is a garbage company with garbage customer support. The router would not power on correctly so I called the customer support number. customer_reviews.text: Rated to get off my rating Que. Tried to get internet with other company so had to purchase different equipment, but company's customer service sucked so cancelled and had to return unneeded modem router.

customer_reviews.title: On My, What a Challenge!
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with this products, got it working and it stopped. Programming is very hard and I feel that you need to have an IT degree to get this done. Finally gave up, placed it back in the box, it is stored outside somewhere. Got a smaller and simpler items that has been working well every since.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin F. Long III

product_meta.title: TP-Link Archer D7 AC1750 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit ADSL2+ Modem Router, 2.4GHz 450Mbps+5GHz 1300Mbps, 2 USB 2.0 Ports, EWAN, IPv6, Guest Network
product_meta.description: Size:Gb (10/100/1000Mbps)| Style:AC1750 Dual BandTP-LINK's Archer D7 AC1750 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit ADSL2+ Modem Router is a combined wired/wireless network connection device with integrated wireless router and ADSL modem, reducing hassle of configuration and saving space. Featuring a variety of features and rich functionality, Archer D7 is the perfect hub of your home or business network. It works with top ISPs - Verizon, Fairpoint, WindStream, AT&T. It is not compatible with FiOS, AT&T U-Verse, or VDSL. ( as stated on the box.)
feature_bullets: Supports 802.11ac standard - the next generation of Wi-Fi
Simultaneous 2.4GHz 450Mbps and 5GHz 1300Mbps connections provide a premium wireless experience
Share a printer locally and files & media with networked devices or remotely via FTP server
Works with Verizon, Fairpoint, Windstream and AT&T ADSL service;

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars2,620 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
